title: What K’Lavon Chaisson and Jaylinn Hawkins said about upcoming free agency
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: K'Lavon Chaisson and Jaylinn Hawkins of the Patriots both expressed interest in returning as free agency approaches.
Chaisson, a linebacker with 7.5 sacks last season, is optimistic about reaching a new deal with the Patriots.
Hawkins, with a career-high four interceptions, values team camaraderie and hopes to remain with the Patriots.

title: A Mass. middle school basketball coach collapsed during a game. The opposing coach sprang into action.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Belmont coach Ian Haffer saved Waltham coach Ronnie Poirier's life during a basketball game after he collapsed from a heart attack.
Haffer, a former hospital clinician, used an automated external defibrillator and CPR to stabilize Poirier before paramedics arrived.
Coach Ronnie Poirier is recovering in the ICU as extensive testing continues, and Belmont school's staff supports affected students.

title: Another movie theater is shutting down in Massachusetts
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Showcase Cinema de Lux in Randolph, featuring IMAX and MX4D, will close March 1, announced owner National Amusements.
National Amusements purchased the Randolph property in 1997; its parent company was acquired by Paramount Skydance in 2025.
The Randolph closure follows Patriot Place's cinema closing, leaving only seven Showcase locations in Massachusetts.

title: Giveaway: Enter to win tickets to a screening of ‘Midwinter Break’
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Boston.com's Love Letters is giving away 10 pairs of tickets to 'Midwinter Break' on Feb. 19 at AMC Boston Common.
To win, submit a relationship question to Love Letters by 11:59 PM EST on Feb. 17, 2026.
The film 'Midwinter Break,' based on Bernard MacLaverty's novel, explores a couple's trip to Amsterdam.

title: Boston meteorologists are ‘watching’ the track of a storm for Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists are monitoring a potential storm expected to approach New England on Presidents' Day, although its impact remains uncertain.
Computer models show mixed signals on whether the storm will bring snow or rain to the Boston area on Monday.
Forecasts indicate the storm currently tracks too far offshore to significantly affect New England, but this could change.

title: Kendrick Perkins explained why the Celtics are ‘the most dangerous team in the NBA’
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Kendrick Perkins claims the Boston Celtics are the most dangerous team in the NBA despite low expectations.
Jaylen Brown is Perkins's pick for MVP, praised as a top-five scorer and defender in the league.
Jayson Tatum's limited return doesn't change the Celtics' status; they remain strong contenders in the East.

title: 4 State Police members relieved of duty as they face charges in recruit’s death
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Four Massachusetts State Police members face manslaughter charges in recruit Enrique Delgado-Garcia's 2024 death.
Lt. Jennifer Penton and three troopers allegedly oversaw unauthorized boxing exercises leading to Delgado-Garcia's fatal injuries.
State Police relieved the officers of duty pending hearings; an independent review of training practices is ongoing.

title: High-end Italian marketplace, Greek restaurant, luxury shops to replace Neiman Marcus at Copley Place
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Neiman Marcus at Copley Place will be replaced by an Italian marketplace and Greek restaurant, plus luxury boutiques.
Simon, the developer, announced brands like Dolce & Gabbana, FENDI, and LOEWE will open in the new space.
The phased development, starting this year and completing by 2028, will include retail, dining, and wellness concepts.

title: Boston was just named funniest city in the U.S. Is it?
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: TicketSource study ranks Boston as the funniest city in the U.S., ahead of Washington, D.C., and San Francisco.
Boston's comedy scene features high demand, numerous venues like The Wilbur, and influential local comedians.
Residents describe Boston's humor as intrinsic, with everyday interactions contributing to the city's comedic reputation.

title: Mass. snow totals by town: See who got the most from fast-moving overnight system
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Gloucester, Massachusetts received the highest snow accumulation, adding six inches in the latest storm.
Most Massachusetts towns reported snow accumulations between 1 to 3 inches from the overnight system.
The National Weather Service provided these snow totals for Massachusetts towns during February 10-11, 2026.
